entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 4:09PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds and Blowing Snow Across Eastern Arctic Coast Friday... West winds will gust 30 to 40 mph on Friday afternoon and continue into Friday night from Deadhorse east. This will cause blowing and drifting snow Friday afternoon and Friday night. Visibility will be briefly less than one mile at times from Friday afternoon through Friday night.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 4:02PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Cold Front Moving Across Eastern Interior Friday... A strong cold front in the Western Interior this afternoon will move to the Central Interior tonight, and then move east to the ALCAN Border by Friday afternoon. Snow, gusty west winds, and much colder temperatures will spread into Tanana and Bettles late tonight, to Fairbanks by early Friday morning, and to the ALCAN
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 07 at 2:25PM PDT until April 09 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW IMPACTING TRAVEL OVER STEVENS PASS FRIDAY NIGHT... .Snow will increase over the Cascade crest Friday evening. Snow rates of one to two inches per hour is expected Friday evening with Stevens Pass expected to quickly become snow covered. Snow will continue over the Cascade crest with accumulations into the morning hours on Saturday resulting in travel impacts.
